title: Mass. men sentenced to prison for mail theft, check fraud scheme
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Imanol Rios-Franco and Brandon Baez received federal prison sentences for depositing checks stolen from the mail.
Rios-Franco was sentenced to 35 months with a year of supervised release and must pay $12,528 in restitution.
From June 2023 to February 2024, they stole checks from USPS boxes, altering and redepositing them into controlled accounts.

title: Milford teen detained by ICE last year invited to State of the Union address
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Milford teen Marcelo Gomes da Silva, detained by ICE last year, invited to attend State of the Union by Rep. Seth Moulton.
Gomes was detained in May 2025 on his way to volleyball practice; ICE targeted his father, leading to collateral arrest.
Gomes, originally from Brazil, was held in Burlington ICE facility for six days, released on $2,000 bond after community support.

title: Jeremy Swayman shares humorous response to regrettable goal in first Olympic start
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed a center-ice goal in Team USA's win against Denmark in Olympic hockey on Saturday.
Swayman lost sight of a shot due to a 'flash screen,' attributing it to the visual conditions on the ice.
Despite the blunders, Team USA's strong offense secured a victory, with Swayman making 18 saves in the game.

title: NBA stars and legends weigh in on Jayson Tatum’s potential return this season
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Kevin Durant and Carmelo Anthony shared perspectives on Jayson Tatum's potential return from an Achilles injury.
Jaylen Brown currently leads Celtics to second seed in East; Tatum's return could impact playoff strategy.
Tatum practices with Celtics’ G League team as return nears, which may bolster Celtics' playoff chances.

title: 5 free agents that might make the most sense for Patriots to pursue at positions of need
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots have $41 million in cap space to address needs in free agency.
Potential targets include Colts WR Alec Pierce and Packers OT Rasheed Walker.
Ravens TE Isaiah Likely and Eagles EDGE Jaelan Phillips are also viable options.

title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: ESPN and MLB.TV form partnership making ESPN the streaming home for Major League Baseball games.
ESPN Unlimited subscribers can add MLB.TV for $134.99; non-subscribers pay $149.99 including a free month of ESPN Unlimited.
Existing MLB.TV subscribers will automatically renew and can stream games via the MLB or ESPN apps after account linking.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Celtics' Jayson Tatum practiced with the Maine Celtics, indicating possible progress in his recovery from an Achilles injury.
Ron Harper Jr. expressed excitement over Tatum's performance but did not confirm his return for the NBA season.
Despite Tatum's practice activities, Celtics have not updated his injury status or provided a return timeline.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts ranked as the most educated state in the 2026 WalletHub study, outperforming all 50 states.
The state has over 47% of adults with bachelor's degrees and nearly 22% with graduate degrees, leading nationally.
Vermont and Maryland followed Massachusetts in education rankings, while Louisiana, Mississippi, and West Virginia placed last.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction — and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: A rare T206 Honus Wagner baseball card is being auctioned by Ken Goldin, featured on Netflix's "King of Collectibles".
The card once owned by Morton Bernstein, with ties to Taunton, Massachusetts, is being auctioned with a bid over $3.9 million.
The card, found in Sweet Caporal Cigarettes, was kept in the Shields family for 116 years before the current auction.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jeremy Swayman will start in net for Team USA against Denmark in Saturday's 2026 Winter Olympics game.
Boston Bruins goalie Swayman, 27, makes his Olympic debut; he helped USA win the 2025 IIHF World Championship.
Connor Hellebuyck is the backup for Saturday's game; Team USA faces Germany on Sunday in their final prelim match.
